docs.text: alexander dumas' the three musketeers is one of the most often-adapted literary works , and for good reason : the swashbuckler is a legend rather than just a story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps the musketeer , a new film that " reimagines " the novel in the spirit and style of the matrix , is one adaptation too many .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's just awful : spiritless , silly and unforgivably boring , transforming the timeless classic into a mish-mash of old-as-time clich ? s and incoherent , repetitive action sequences .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this time , d'artagnan is played by calvin klein model justin chambers , who can't even pronounce his character's name .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a boy , he watched his father get killed by febre ( tim roth ) , a lackey of power-hungry cardinal richelieu .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he vowed to have vengeance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after undergoing intense training under an expert swordsman , he goes looking for his enemy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on his quest , he embroils himself in a struggle for control at the highest levels of the french government .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the royal musketeers have lost their gusto , what with their jobs being taken over by the cardinal's own guards .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only a few loyal swashbuckers remain , among them athos and portos ( who are only figureheads in this movie ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: together with d'artagnan , they fight to extricate the queen ( catherine deneuve ) from the traps that febre and richelieu are trying to plant .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh , and as an afterthought , d'artagnan falls in love with the poor maid at the local inn ( mena suvari ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: just thought i'd mention that .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now , look : i don't know whose idea this was , but whoever is responsible deserves a severe tongue-lashing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have nothing against " modernizing " classic works of literature - at the very least , they can inspire viewers to actually read the book - but films as dull as this have no positive side effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director peter hyams , known for such masterpieces of modern cinema as timecop and end of days , has jettisoned everything that was great about dumas' masterwork : the sense of excitement , cause , and camaraderie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , we get impressively choreographed but somehow vacuous , uninvolving action sequences that emerge from emptiness and lead to nothing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when the musketeers finally get to holler " all for one , and one for all , " i could have sworn that was dumas rolling in his grave that i felt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe the reason for the utter lack of suspense here is the hyams's tone , which is unreasonably dark and brooding when you consider the reader's digest condensed version of the story that he gives us .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's as though anything that may have been construed as " fun " was purposely expunged from the production .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the joylessness of the proceedings , from the oppressively shady lighting to the mechanical fight scenes , can be felt in every frame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chambers can't act ; suvari , roth and deneuve can , but aren't given the chance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and when push comes to shove , the use of stunt doubles is distractingly obvious , though at least roth gets to play a villain without having to wear an ape suit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some movies seem sloppy and careless , clearly made for a quick buck .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the musketeer we get the sense that it was meticulously crafted to be awful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is intricate , stylish and precise , hitting the wrong note every single time .
docs.label: negative
